meanings.definition: A subordinate depot or branch of a larger depot.
meanings.sent1: The subdepot was a small storage area next to the main warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The subdepot received shipments from the main depot every week.
meanings.sent3: The subdepot was like a little sibling to the big warehouse, always trying to keep up.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of storage facilities, the subdepot was the loyal assistant to the main depot.
meanings.sent5: The subdepot, with its limited space, served as a humble support to the larger warehouse.

meanings.definition: A place where goods or supplies are stored temporarily before being distributed.
meanings.sent1: After unloading the trucks, the goods were placed in the subdepot for sorting.
meanings.sent2: The subdepot was a busy hub of activity as workers prepared shipments for delivery.
meanings.sent3: The subdepot played hide-and-seek with the packages, keeping them safe until they were sent out.
meanings.sent4: The subdepot was a bustling stopover for goods on their journey to different destinations.
meanings.sent5: The subdepot buzzed with energy as products awaited their next destination.
